intro: Linanthastrum nuttallii subsp. floribundum, commonly known as the flowering linanthastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
